sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using QR decomposition
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using QR decomposition:

3x + 4y + 2z = 11
-2x + 5y + 7z = 3
x - 8y + 6z = -7

Round your final answers to 2 decimal places.
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using QR decomposition, we first need to write the system in matrix form Ax = b, where A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the column vector of variables, and b is the column vector of constants.

A = |  3  4  2 |
    | -2  5  7 |
    |  1 -8  6 |

b = | 11 |
    |  3 |
    | -7 |

Now, we perform QR decomposition on matrix A, which means we factor A into an orthogonal matrix Q and an upper triangular matrix R.

Using the Gram-Schmidt process, we can find the orthogonal basis for the column space of A:

u1 = a1 = |  3 |
          | -2 |
          |  1 |

e1 = u1 / ||u1|| = |  3/√14 |
                   | -2/√14 |
                   |  1/√14 |

u2 = a2 - (a2·e1)e1 = |  4 - (20/14)e1 |
                      |  5 - (4/14)e1  |
                      | -8 - (4/14)e1  |

e2 = u2 / ||u2|| = |  2/√35  |
                   |  3/√35  |
                   | -4/√35  |

u3 = a3 - (a3·e1)e1 - (a3·e2)e2 = |  2 - (10/14)e1 - (2/35)e2 |
                                  |  7 - (18/14)e1 - (9/35)e2 |
                                  |  6 - (10/14)e1 - (12/35)e2 |

e3 = u3 / ||u3|| = |  1/√6  |
                   |  2/√6  |
                   |  1/√6  |

Now, we can form the orthogonal matrix Q and the upper triangular matrix R:

Q = |  3/√14  2/√35  1/√6 |
    | -2/√14  3/√35  2/√6 |
    |  1/√14 -4/√35  1/√6 |

R = | ||u1|| (e1·a2) (e1·a3) | = | √14  20/√14  10/√14 |
    |    0    ||u2|| (e2·a3) |   |   0    √35    9/√35 |
    |    0      0    ||u3||   |   |   0      0     √6  |

Now, we can solve the system Rx = Q^Tb:

Q^T = |  3/√14 -2/√14  1/√14 |
      |  2/√35  3/√35 -4/√35 |
      |  1/√6   2/√6   1/√6  |

Q^Tb = | (3/√14)(11) + (-2/√14)(3) + (1/√14)(-7) |
       | (2/√35)(11) + (3/√35)(3) + (-4/√35)(-7) |
       | (1/√6)(11)  + (2/√6)(3)  + (1/√6)(-7)  |

Q^Tb = | 10 |
       |  9 |
       |  6 |

Now, we can solve the upper triangular system Rx = Q^Tb using back substitution:

z = 6 / √6 ≈ 2.45
y = (9 - (9/√35) * 2.45) / √35 ≈ 0.89
x = (10 - (20/√14) * 0.89 - (10/√14) * 2.45) / √14 ≈ 1.00

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is approximately:

x ≈ 1.00
y ≈ 0.89
z ≈ 2.45
